allowance(address,address).details: This function makes it easy to read the `allowed[]` map

params._owner: The address of the account that owns the token
params._spender: The address of the account able to transfer the tokens

allowance(address,address).return: Amount of remaining tokens of _owner that _spender is allowed  to spend

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be approved for transfer
params._spender: The address of the account able to transfer the tokens

approve(address,uint256).return: True if the approval was successful

getOwnerEIN().details: This contracts allows you to set ownership based on EIN instead of address

getTotalSupply().details: This function makes it easy to get the total number of tokens

isOwner().details: This works on EINs, not on addresses
isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract

renounceOwnership().details: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner modifier anymore.

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred

transfer(address,uint256).return: Whether the transfer was successful or not

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred
params._from: The address holding the tokens being transferred

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).return: True if the transfer was successful

transferOwnership(uint256).details: This works on EINs, not on addresses

devdoc.author: Fatima Castiglione Maldonado <castiglionemaldonado@gmail.com>
devdoc.details: The SnowflakeOwnable contract has an owner EIN, and provides basic authorization control functions, not based on an address as it is usual, but based on an EIN. This simplifies the implementation of "user permissions" when using Snowflakes.

constructor.details: The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender account

params._identityRegistryAddress: The address of the IdentityRegistry contract

getOwnerEIN().details: This contracts allows you to set ownership based on EIN instead of address

isOwner().details: This works on EINs, not on addresses
isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract

renounceOwnership().details: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner modifier anymore.

transferOwnership(uint256).details: This works on EINs, not on addresses

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two numbers, reverts on overflow.

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two numbers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two numbers, reverts on overflow.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Divides two numbers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
nodes.name: mod
